objectives_aims_scope.study_title: Shapley Values for Feature Selection: The Good, the Bad, and the Axioms
objectives: To introduce the use of Shapley values in feature selection.
To draw attention to limitations of using Shapley values for feature selection.
To scrutinize the axiomatic guarantees associated with Shapley values in feature selection contexts.
aims: To clarify limitations around the use of Shapley values for feature selection in the literature.
To help demystify certain aspects of the Shapley value axioms viewed as 'favourable'.
To analyze when Shapley value axioms do not provide a guarantee that the Shapley value is suited to feature selection.
scope: The study uses simple, abstract 'toy' counterexamples and concrete simulation settings.
To investigate a variety of Shapley value formulations such as SHapley Additive exPlanations (SHAP) and Shapley Additive Global importancE (SAGE).
To consider the implications of Shapley value axioms and game formulations on feature selection.

contexts_investigated: The influence of Shapley value axioms in the Naïve Application of feature selection.
Pathologies in different Data Generating Processes (DGPs) using SHAP and SAGE methods.
limitations_highlighted: The axioms do not guarantee that Shapley values are suited for feature selection.
Model averaging as characterized by Shapley values can be misleading in optimal model contexts.
